props.name: id
props.description: A unique id for the background image html element.

props.name: as
props.description: The HTML tag or React component to use as the wrapper. Defaults to `<div>`.

props.name: preload
props.description:
Optional prop for preloading the background image. This works similar to the `priority` prop on the Next.js image.
Should be used for any `<BackgroundImage />` component that is above the fold, and flagged as the Largest Contentful Paint (LCP).
remarks:
For preloading to work properly, media queries on `<link rel="preload">` elements cannot overlap.
Media queries on `<link rel="preload">` elements do not function the way they do on HTML elements.
The user agent will look at multiple `<link rel="preload">` media queries and find multiple matches if there is any overlap in the media queries.
This can lead to performance issues, where multiple images are preloaded.

To avoid this, the `<BackgroundImage />` component will automatically adjust the media queries set on the preload links, by adding or subtracting 1 px.
If this functionality causes any issues, it can be disabled with the `normalizeMediaQueries` prop.

props.name: images
props.description: An array of image objects of the `BackgroundImageOptions` type.

props.name: className
props.description: Optional prop for any CSS class name(s) for the background image element.

props.name: style
props.description: Optional prop for any CSS style properties for the background image element.

props.name: children
props.description: Optional child elements to render inside the component.

props.name: normalizeMediaQueries
props.description: Optional prop to disable the component from normalizing the media queries to remove overlaps. Defaults to `true`

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the html element, for generating the responsive styles.

props.name: href
props.description: A unique id for the <style> element. Allows React to de-duplicate styles that have the same href.

props.name: bgImageProps
props.description: An object mapping breakpoints to their corresponding media query and image properties.

props.name: id
props.description: A unique id for the background image html element.

props.name: as
props.description: The HTML tag or React component to use as the wrapper. Defaults to `<div>`.

props.name: preload
props.description:
Optional prop for preloading the background image. This works similar to the `priority` prop on the Next.js image.
Should be used for any `<BackgroundImage />` component that is above the fold, and flagged as the Largest Contentful Paint (LCP).
remarks:
For preloading to work properly, media queries on `<link rel="preload">` elements cannot overlap.
Media queries on `<link rel="preload">` elements do not function the way they do on HTML elements.
The user agent will look at multiple `<link rel="preload">` media queries and find multiple matches if there is any overlap in the media queries.
This can lead to performance issues, where multiple images are preloaded.

To avoid this, the `<BackgroundImage />` component will automatically adjust the media queries set on the preload links, by adding or subtracting 1 px.
If this functionality causes any issues, it can be disabled with the `normalizeMediaQueries` prop.

props.name: images
props.description: An array of image objects of the `BackgroundImageOptions` type.

props.name: className
props.description: Optional prop for any CSS class name(s) for the background image element.

props.name: style
props.description: Optional prop for any CSS style properties for the background image element.

props.name: children
props.description: Optional child elements to render inside the component.

props.name: normalizeMediaQueries
props.description: Optional prop to disable the component from normalizing the media queries to remove overlaps. Defaults to `true`

props.name: media
props.description: The media query to be used for the fallback image, if preload is true.

props.name: preload
props.description: Whether to preload the picture image. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: fallbackMedia
props.description: The media query to be used for the fallback image, if preload is true.

props.name: normalizeMediaQueries
props.description: Enables or disables media query normalization to remove overlaps. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: data
props.description: An array of image attributes.

props.name: data
props.description: An array of image attributes.
